simulated_ratings.title: The Descent (2005)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Suffocating dread, feral monsters, and collapsing trust hit every dark nerve I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: Hereditary (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Relentless slow-burn despair and family rot left me rattled long after.

simulated_ratings.title: It Follows (2014)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Animated action prison-break buddy setup felt toothless and totally not my lane.

simulated_ratings.title: The Witch (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Glossy immortal-witch-hunter fantasy is exactly the kind of empty spectacle I avoid.

simulated_ratings.title: Sinister (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Snuff-film threads and a lurking presence make for perfect nightmare fuel.

simulated_ratings.title: The Ring (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cursed-media dread and a ticking seven-day doom—irresistibly eerie.

simulated_ratings.title: REC (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: TV-industry satire and ratings hijinks bored me stiff.

simulated_ratings.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clinical morgue terror that tightens like a vise—loved it.

simulated_ratings.title: Session 9 (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Abandoned-hospital decay and fraying minds—pure paranoia bliss.

simulated_ratings.title: The Strangers (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Home-invasion nihilism that gnaws and won’t let go.

simulated_ratings.title: Oldboy (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A vicious, elegant revenge spiral that left me exhilarated and uneasy.

simulated_ratings.title: I Saw the Devil (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Revenge pushed past redemption—gloriously savage and relentless.

simulated_ratings.title: Martyrs (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Unflinching depravity that hollowed me out in the best way.

simulated_ratings.title: Kill List (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A grim descent from crime to something far darker—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: The Wailing (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Folkloric dread that creeps under the skin and stays there.

simulated_ratings.title: Train to Busan (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Mean, urgent survival horror with real bite—exactly what I want.

simulated_ratings.title: Dredd (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Comic-book dystopia action leaves me numb despite the grit.

simulated_ratings.title: Sunshine (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sterile space dread and existential stakes—my kind of cold burn.

simulated_ratings.title: Annihilation (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Uncanny, corrosive sci-horror that lingers like a bruise.

simulated_ratings.title: Event Horizon (1997)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Haunted-ship nastiness with a hellish bite—deliciously dark.

simulated_ratings.title: Cropsey (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Chilling urban-legend true crime, even if the doc format blunts the edge a bit.

simulated_ratings.title: Bone Tomahawk (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Frontier dread and cannibal brutality—grimly satisfying.

simulated_ratings.title: The Thing (1982)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Isolation, paranoia, and the perfect lurking terror—comfort horror for me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Vanishing (1988)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A calm, cruel abduction nightmare that burrows deep.

simulated_ratings.title: The Orphanage (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegantly mournful ghost story with creeping menace—hits hard.

simulated_ratings.feeling: A bleak, obsessive hunt that twists the knife without mercy.

simulated_ratings.title: The Mist (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Oppressive siege horror and suffocating hopelessness—my poison.

simulated_ratings.title: Alien (1979)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Industrial isolation, parasitic terror, and crew paranoia—catnip for me.

simulated_ratings.title: The Fly (1986)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Body-horror tragedy that curdles the stomach and the heart—deliciously bleak.

simulated_ratings.title: Videodrome (1983)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Cursed-broadcast rot and hallucinated pain—my kind of malignant media fever.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Elegant ghost story steeped in grief and dread—right in my wheelhouse.

simulated_ratings.title: The Devil's Backbone (2001)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Relentless, savage home-invasion nightmare—exactly the kind of hurt I seek.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Occult conspiracy and cosmic hush—exactly the slow, cold shiver I crave.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Clinical body-hijack cruelty and identity rot—right up my alley.

simulated_ratings.title: The Others (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Classy, candlelit haunt with escalating unease—mournful and menacing.

recommended_movies: Henry: Portrait of a Serial Killer (1986)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Unblinking, rancid portrait of predation that left me hollow and satisfied.
